rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;3b54eaca.1503">   <title>Re: Student Visitor Visas </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;3b54eaca.1503</link>   <description> Simon,<br><br>I think that this needs to be sent on the UKVI also, as this is not the position as far as they are concerned - and from a legal stance I have agreed with their position.<br><br>The only route that has supported the student who re-enters the UK to sit either and examination of a re-sit module sub 6 months is the Visitors Visa (Student) in accordance with para 56K of the Immigration Rules. The SVV never covered this as an option and related to recreational courses and periods of study of 30 days, concurrent and consecutive. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T11:26:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Yetton, Peter</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;3b54eaca.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;7659c216.1503</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;7659c216.1503">FW: Student Visitor Visas </a></description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T09:13:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Simon Maller</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;7659c216.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;668dd859.1503">   <title>Re: Tier 1 (Graduate Entrepreneur) Visa </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;668dd859.1503</link>   <description> Dear Mike<br><br>We will be running the Tier 1 GE scheme again in 15/16 and we are not intending to accept students from other institutions.<br><br>Best wishes<br><br>Claire<br><br>Claire O'Leary<br>Assistant Director (Student Experience)<br>International Office University of Warwick Kirby Corner Road Coventry CV4 8UW<br>Tel: 00 44 (0) 24 7657 5228<br>Fax: 00 44 (0) 24 7652 4337 [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T15:00:44+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>O'Leary, Claire</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;668dd859.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;ada82fb3.1503">   <title>Tier 1 (Graduate Entrepreneur) Visa </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;ada82fb3.1503</link>   <description> Dear All<br><br>I wonder if you would mind letting me know if you are planning to run Tier 1 (GE) schemes for 2015/16. In the past Durham has ran the scheme with limited success but we are not planning to run it again in the future.<br><br>Would you be able to confirm if you are planning to run this scheme in the future, and also, would you be prepared to accept students from other institutions? [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T09:19:17+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>PARKS M.A.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;ada82fb3.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;59fd9f2e.1503">   <title>Re: Doctoral Training Centre (DTCs) - Visa Requirement </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;59fd9f2e.1503</link>   <description> I note that the Non-teaching partnership section of the recent consultation has been omitted from the new Sponsor Guidance.<br><br>Where the output from a Doctoral Training Centre takes the form of a joint-degree, e.g. a requirement of study at more than one location for an MRes or jointly supervised PhDs, then Table 3 of the new guidance (Para 68 onwards) applies and is seemingly quite clear cut (the partnership must be listed on both licences regardless of which sponsor is issuing CAS under the partnership). [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T10:48:45+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Chris Buckland</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;59fd9f2e.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;da542de6.1503">   <title>New Guidance </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;da542de6.1503</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;da542de6.1503">New Guidance </a></description>   <dc:date>2015-03-05T08:02:40+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Simon Maller</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;da542de6.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;4e4890c9.1503">   <title>ARC UKVI PG Meeting: 17 April 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;4e4890c9.1503</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;4e4890c9.1503">ARC UKVI PG Meeting: 17 April 2015 </a></description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T13:04:44+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Simon Maller</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;4e4890c9.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;28e17b31.1502">   <title>Fwd: BRP note - urgent (success!) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;28e17b31.1502</link>   <description> Dear all<br><br>Dominic from UKCISA agree to do a summary from yesterday's meeting at the Home Office, see below.<br><br>This is a very positive development but has yet to be agreed by the Home Office Security section and the Minister.<br><br>I will keep you updated.<br><br>Best wishes<br><br>Jon<br><br>Jon Pink<br>Academic Registrar<br>University of Kent<br>The Registry<br>Canterbury<br>Kent<br>CT2 7NZ<br>j.pink@kent.ac.uk&lt;mailto:j.pink@kent.ac.uk&gt;<br>01227 823673&lt;tel:01227%20823673&gt; [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-28T07:45:18+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jon Pink</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;28e17b31.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;dc05fe07.1502">   <title>Re: Doctoral Training Centre (DTCs) - Visa Requirement </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;dc05fe07.1502</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;dc05fe07.1502">Re: Doctoral Training Centre (DTCs) - Visa Requirement </a></description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T14:23:16+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Simon Maller</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;dc05fe07.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;b9422613.1502">   <title>Re: Doctoral Training Centre (DTCs) - Visa Requirement </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;b9422613.1502</link>   <description> Thank you for highlighting this. It would seem a reasonable move to make to ask VCs to lobby and possibly UUK.<br>It feels inconceivable to add numerous institutions as partners and the difficulties this could lead to.<br>This could possibly be managed in a similar way to a work placements if the students spend chunks of time at another institution ie details and dates.<br>If they are moving between both institutions it could be possible just to note this. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T13:35:37+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jane Bland</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;b9422613.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;2da5c323.1502">   <title>Re: Doctoral Training Centre (DTCs) - Visa Requirement </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;2da5c323.1502</link>   <description> Chris,<br><br>I have heard of nothing so far, but certainly needs to be challenged.<br><br>Best<br><br>Pete    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T11:17:37+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Yetton, Peter</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;2da5c323.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;85744c4f.1502">   <title>Doctoral Training Centre (DTCs) - Visa Requirement </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;85744c4f.1502</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>This was discussed at the December meeting - from the minutes;<br><br>7.1 A member raised an issue in respect to the "place of study" section within the guidance as highlighting the fact that a number of their research students who were part of a multi-institution, BIS funded Doctoral Training Centre (DTCs), had been advised that the students could not study by the UKVI Premium Service Account manager, as it would contravene the place of study rule. When asked if there was an alternative approach which would derive at the same outcome, the response was that the University should [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T10:57:51+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Chris Buckland</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;85744c4f.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;bea0ef3f.1502">   <title>UUK Election Tool Kit </title> href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;bea0ef3f.1502">UUK Election Tool Kit </a></description>   <dc:date>2015-02-23T19:17:36+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Simon Maller</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;bea0ef3f.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;a25e7039.1502">   <title>English Language Testing Change </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;a25e7039.1502</link>   <description> Hi All,<br><br>Might be of interest to everyone:<br><br>http://www.trinitycollege.com/news/viewarticle.php?id=396<br><br>Our admission team are watching this space with other English Test providers and test centres.<br><br>Kind Regards,<br><br>Graeme Davies<br>Tier 4 Compliance Officer<br><br>Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/LSBUInternationalStudents<br><br>International Office<br>London South Bank University<br>103 Borough Road, London SE1 0AA<br>Tel: +44 (0)20 7815 6137<br>Email: cas@lsbu.ac.uk&lt;mailto:cas@lsbu.ac.uk&gt;<br>Web: www.lsbu.ac.uk&lt;http://www.lsbu.ac.uk/&gt;<br>P Please consider the environment before printing<br>[cid:image001.jpg@01CD0B5A.C051A230]&lt;http://www.lsbu.ac.uk/&gt;<br>[cid:image002.jpg@01CD0B5A.C051A230]&lt;http://www.lsbu.ac.uk/about/connectLSBU.shtml&gt; [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-20T12:01:04+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Davies, Graeme 8</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;a25e7039.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;9dc0f669.1502">   <title>Minutes of meeting: 12/12/2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;9dc0f669.1502</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;9dc0f669.1502">Minutes of meeting: 12/12/2014 </a></description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T08:53:16+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Simon Maller</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;9dc0f669.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;e5e8dc4e.1502">   <title>Unsubscribe from list </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;e5e8dc4e.1502</link>   <description> I have had a number of emails asking to be removed from the list.<br><br>My office does not administer the list now so I cannot help. However if you go to:<br><br>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/help/subscribers/subscribercommands.html<br><br>There are instructions on how to unsubscribe from any JISC list by sending an email with a command in it.<br><br>Best wishes [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-12T08:53:43+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jon Pink</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;e5e8dc4e.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;34aa580a.1502">   <title>Re: Collection opf BIDs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;34aa580a.1502</link>   <description> Hi Jon,<br>I had a quick trip round the 3 post offices in Bristol yesterday evening. From what I could see they all had a maximum of two windows. Only one was in use at each when I looked in so you could argue they all have scope for doubling the counter staff. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-10T10:04:52+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Simon Cox</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;34aa580a.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;791bc3a9.1502">   <title>Kindly remove me from this list </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;791bc3a9.1502</link>   <description> I am no longer involved with Visa matters at LBS<br><br>Sent from my iPad<br><br>On 9 Feb 2015, at 11:00, Arnold C.D. (Clive) &lt;C.D.Arnold@SOTON.AC.UK&lt;mailto:C.D.Arnold@SOTON.AC.UK&gt;&gt; wrote:<br><br>Jon<br>I have liaised with my local Postal Manager and it appears the contracts have been signed with the Post Office, so I think there is little room to manoeuvre on this.<br>My local Post Office clearly have little appreciation of the sheer volume of work this is likely to create in September.<br>This applies not just those collecting but those students arriving to collect their BIDs, being told they are not there yet and [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T14:11:32+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Fiona Sandford</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;791bc3a9.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;1a41b21c.1502">   <title>Re: Collection of BIDs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;1a41b21c.1502</link>   <description> Dear Jane,<br><br>The Home Office has already been reminded of those issues and we will continue to press them for reassurance and evidence that the same issues will not reoccur at post offices.<br><br>As mentioned before, although there seems to be private recognition within government that police registration is of little value, it is highly unlikely that it will be scrapped in advance of the general election or in its immediate aftermath. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T13:39:00+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jo Attwooll</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;1a41b21c.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;d9468df3.1502">   <title>Re: Collection of BIDs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;d9468df3.1502</link>   <description> Hi Jo,<br>I am sure this has been discussed but could you remind HO about the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdproblems\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd in London around police registration and that the BIDs collection process adds yet another queueing layer for students, when they are trying to settle in to university life and meet attendance requirements.<br>As the OVRO cannot manage the volume of students requiring police registration, in September and October institutions are required to carry out a lot of extra work in this area, checking documents sending them to the OVRO. The students then have to visit the OVRO at a later date to collect [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T13:06:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jane Bland</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;d9468df3.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;e72be664.1502">   <title>Re: Collection of BIDs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;e72be664.1502</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>Just to add to Jon\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds initial comments.<br><br>The Home Office are open to continuing discussions on this issue but as Jon highlights initial indications are that it is unlikely that institutions will be able to distribute the biometric documents to students, at least in the short-term. This is because of logistical and security considerations. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T11:29:35+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jo Attwooll</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;e72be664.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;f220601d.1502">   <title>Re: Collection of BIDs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;f220601d.1502</link>   <description> Jon<br>I have liaised with my local Postal Manager and it appears the contracts have been signed with the Post Office, so I think there is little room to manoeuvre on this.<br>My local Post Office clearly have little appreciation of the sheer volume of work this is likely to create in September.<br>This applies not just those collecting but those students arriving to collect their BIDs, being told they are not there yet and returning day after day; as they are limited to a 10 day window from arrival in the UK. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T10:49:37+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Arnold C.D. (Clive)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;f220601d.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;57791ff0.1502">   <title>Re: Collection opf BIDs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;57791ff0.1502</link>   <description> Jon,<br>I have been through the list for Bristol and having looked at them via street map it is interesting how the phrase main post office is not the same as large post office.<br><br>At first look all two of the three PO's are not single use one being a pharmacy, one a newsagent and none are what I would think of as large. I do not know what the view of Uni of Bristol is in terms of this but I have real concerns about the how this will work and whether the PO's concerned know what they are [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T10:38:15+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Simon Cox</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;57791ff0.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;c02496af.1502">   <title>Re: Collection opf BIDs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;c02496af.1502</link>   <description> Hi Chris<br><br>No this would not be enough. There are certain requirements for the storage of the BIDs, though most Unis may have a large safe, it appears it must be of a certain standard. Staff would need to be security vetted and there can be no foreign nationals in the process. The security vetting is very high and the person from the HO overseeing this said that some staff do not want to be vetted as the level may reveal things that they would not want revealed but would not affect a Uni employing them. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T10:03:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jon Pink</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;c02496af.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;de58fd2b.1502">   <title>Re: Collection of BIDs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;de58fd2b.1502</link>   <description> Judith<br><br>The HO have provided the PO with the pattern of BIDs over the year and expect the PO to be able to respond to the demand with extra staff, though this does not help if the number of counters are restricted!<br><br>Jo from UUK has also provided the HO with data from HESA regarding the number of new students registering with Universities. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T09:52:52+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jon Pink</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;de58fd2b.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;e7c36f93.1502">   <title>Re: Collection opf BIDs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;e7c36f93.1502</link>   <description> Rob<br><br>The collection POs are only those that meet the security requirements of the HO, I can check if this list is the complete list but I believe it is.<br><br>Also see my reply to John about coming on campus.<br><br>Jon<br><br>Jon Pink<br><br>Academic Registrar, Academic Division | University of Kent<br>Room 103, Registry Building, Canterbury, Kent CT2 7NZ, UK<br>01227 823673, j.pink@kent.ac.uk&lt;mailto:j.pink@kent.ac.uk&gt; [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T09:45:34+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jon Pink</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;e7c36f93.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;57f8c4ec.1502">   <title>Re: Collection opf BIDs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;57f8c4ec.1502</link>   <description> John<br><br>There was a discussion, to be continued at the next meeting, about the PO coming onto campuses. However the logistics and security may prevent this.<br><br>The BIDs for students represent about 25% of the total number of BIDs and all are printed and distributed from the DVLC. There is not the facility to sort the BIDs by sponsor only by the PO for collection. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T09:44:05+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jon Pink</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;57f8c4ec.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;d0194a90.1502">   <title>Collection opf BIDs </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;d0194a90.1502</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues<br><br>Further to the meeting at the Home Office last week they have provided us with a list of the Post Offices which are part of the &quot;Secure Collection Network&quot; for the HO.<br><br>My understanding is that these are the locations where the Post Office propose to offer the collection of BIDs. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T09:08:17+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jon Pink</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;d0194a90.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;2bd5e65c.1502">   <title>Increase fee for issuing a CAS </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;2bd5e65c.1502</link>   <description> In response to the increased cost to issue a CAS to \ufffd\ufffd21 I was wondering if any institutions are planning on charging an admin fee to recover some of the cost. This is something we may consider and I'm curious if others are considering this as well so would be interested in responses to the questions below. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-06T12:53:28+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rebecca Blight</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;2bd5e65c.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;119708fc.1502">   <title>Proposed changes to fees 2015/16 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;119708fc.1502</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;119708fc.1502">Proposed changes to fees 2015/16 </a></description>   <dc:date>2015-02-06T10:59:09+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Simon Maller</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;119708fc.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;91ef98c0.1502">   <title>One or Two CAS </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;91ef98c0.1502</link>   <description> Hi All,<br><br>I have been asked if the University can assign one CAS for an extended IT degree program which is sold as a 4 year course - which includes one year IT foundation year which prepares students for study onto a 3 year IT undergraduate program.<br><br>I was wondering if institutions don't assign one CAS for a foundation (year 0) plus undergraduate degree program because the Home Office doesn't say you can? And the right thing to do is to assign two CAS's, the second after the student successfully completes the foundation year. Paragraph 46 of the Document 2 [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-02T15:59:24+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Davies, Graeme 8</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ARC-UKBAPG;91ef98c0.1502</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
